conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have height and thickness, multiple faces are visible, and the view is an angled/isometric perspective with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion of walls with readable corners and interior volume; clean cutaway with consistent wall heights. Minor simplification of some wall edges/openings reduces geometric rigor slightly.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall apartment massing and main zones (living/dining/kitchen + two bedroom wings + central hall) match the 2D plan, but several internal partitions/door placements appear simplified and some secondary rooms (closets/bath partitioning) are not clearly faithful.

interior_elements.notes: Living/dining and kitchen elements are present (table, seating, kitchen run). Bedrooms and some ancillary spaces appear largely unfurnished/under-detailed compared to the 2D plan; bathroom fixture completeness is unclear/inconsistent across all wet areas.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable walls/floors/openings with neutral materials and a clean background; lighting is adequate though some areas are dim and low-contrast, making smaller partitions/openings harder to verify.

detected_errors.description: Noticeable simplification/possible misalignment of some interior partitions and secondary spaces (closets/bath subdivisions) relative to the 2D plan.
Doors/openings are not consistently verifiable on the same walls as in the 2D plan (some appear omitted or relocated).
Bedrooms and some rooms lack the major furniture shown/implied in the 2D plan, reducing room identity confirmation.

summary: A valid cutaway 3D conversion with strong 3D fundamentals and broadly correct zoning, but with simplified partitions/openings and missing room furniture that limit strict plan fidelity verification.
